title: Galbi (Short Ribs)
description: Marinated Korean-style beef short ribs grilled or broiled until caramelized and tender, featuring a savory-sweet soy and pear marinade with garlic and sesame. Ideal for weeknight dinners or special occasions, served with rice and kimchi for bold, umami-rich flavor.

ingredients.display_name: beef flanken-style short ribs (cut across bones, about 1/4-inch thick)
ingredients.notes: ask butcher for flanken cut across bones; about 8-10 pieces

ingredients.display_name: korean pear or ripe asian pear (peeled and roughly chopped)
ingredients.notes: for natural tenderizing and sweetness; can substitute apple if needed
light or dark brown sugar depending on preference
adds shine and balanced sweetness; optional but recommended

ingredients.display_name: green onion / scallion (thinly sliced, white and green parts)
neutral oil (for grill or pan searing)
ingredients.notes: can use vegetable or canola oil

steps.text: Prepare the marinade: puree the peeled pear until smooth in a blender or grate finely and squeeze, then combine with soy sauce, brown sugar, mirin (if using), sesame oil, minced garlic, grated ginger, and black pepper in a large bowl. Stir until sugar dissolves.

Marinate the short ribs: place the short ribs in a large zip-top bag or shallow dish, pour the marinade over the meat ensuring all pieces are coated, add sliced scallions, press out excess air, and refrigerate to marinate for minimum 2 hours but preferably 4–6 hours or up to overnight for best flavor.
Bring to near room temperature: remove marinated short ribs from refrigerator 30 minutes before cooking to take the chill off which promotes even cooking. Reserve marinade.

Preheat grill or broiler: if grilling, preheat to medium-high (around 425–450°F); if broiling, set oven rack 4–6 inches from heat and preheat broiler. Oil grates or a heavy skillet lightly to prevent sticking.

Sear and cook the ribs: remove excess marinade from meat (shake off) and place ribs on the hot grill or in a hot cast-iron skillet. Cook until deeply charred at the edges and caramelized, about 3–4 minutes per side for thin flanken ribs. Flip and continue cooking until caramelized and internal texture is tender — total active cook about 8–12 minutes depending on thickness. Work in batches if needed.

Reduce reserved marinade (optional for glaze): bring reserved marinade to a simmer in a small saucepan and cook 3–4 minutes until slightly thickened and safe to brush on meat; if broiling/grilling, brush during last minute of cooking to glaze.
Rest and garnish: transfer cooked ribs to a platter, let rest 5 minutes to redistribute juices, then garnish with toasted sesame seeds and remaining sliced scallions.
Serve: plate with steamed rice and optional kimchi or lettuce leaves for wrapping. Provide tongs or chopsticks and slice between bones if pieces are large.
